snippet: Black immigrants are expected to make up an increasing share of the nation’s black population in the decades ahead, the Pew Research Center found.
abstract: Pew Research Center study finds population of black immigrants in United States has increased four-fold since 1980, primarily due to 137 percent increase in African immigrants between 2000 and 2013; New York metropolitan area is home to 27 percent of nation's black immigrants.
lead_paragraph: Black immigrants are expected to make up an increasing share of the nation’s black population in the decades ahead, the Pew Research Center found.

headline.main: Black Immigrants Have Quadrupled Since 1980, Study Says
